intro: Diospyros juruensis subsp. campechiana, commonly known as the Campeche persimmon, is a species native to parts of Central America and northern South America. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall, with smooth, gray bark and elliptical leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange to red, fleshy fruits that are edible when ripe. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for various wildlife and its potential economic value in local agriculture.
